00038 #ifndef SC_JOIN_H
00039 #define SC_JOIN_H
00040 
00041 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_process.h"
00042 #include "sysc/kernel/sc_wait.h"
00043 
00044 namespace sc_core {
00045 
00046 //==============================================================================
00047 // CLASS sc_join
00048 //
00049 // This class provides a way of waiting for a set of threads to complete their
00050 // execution. The threads whose completion is to be monitored are registered,
00051 // and upon their completion an event notification will occur.
00052 //==============================================================================
00053 class SC_API sc_join : public sc_process_monitor {
00054     friend class sc_process_b;
00055     friend class sc_process_handle;
00056   public:
00057     sc_join();
00058     void add_process( sc_process_handle process_h );
00059     inline int process_count();
00060     virtual void signal(sc_thread_handle thread_p, int type);
00061     inline void wait();
00062     inline void wait_clocked();
00063 
00064   protected: 
00065     void add_process( sc_process_b* process_p );
00066 
00067   protected:
00068     sc_event m_join_event;  // Event to notify when all threads have reported.
00069     int      m_threads_n;   // # of threads still need to wait for.
00070 
00071   private:
00072     sc_join( const sc_join& );
00073     sc_join& operator = ( const sc_join& );
00074 };
00075 
00076 int sc_join::process_count() { return m_threads_n; }
00077 
00078 // suspend a thread that does not have a sensitivity list:
00079 
00080 inline void sc_join::wait() { ::sc_core::wait(m_join_event); }
00081 
00082 // suspend a thread that has a sensitivity list:
00083 
00084 inline void sc_join::wait_clocked()
00085 {
00086     do { ::sc_core::wait(); } while (m_threads_n != 0);
00087 }
